text: hey guys it's ro welcome back to my
channel i got so many requests from you
guys to make best basic recipes and i've
been seeing a lot of these over the
internet like a recipe for the best
banana bread or recipe for the best
carrot cake so today i'm gonna share
with you
my favorite the best chocolate chip
cookie recipe and a big thanks to
ghirardelli for sponsoring this video
and sending me sustainably sourced and
delicious chocolate chips that we're
using today the holidays are almost here
i may have already taken a christmas
tree out of the garage just to just you
know dust it off just just to get me in
a cheery mood and one of my most
cherished things that i do is i get the
family together and we bake cookies
especially chocolate chip cookies if
baking was a sport the holidays are
cookie season and i know what some of
you may think you may think bro you've
already made a chocolate chip cookie
recipe yes i did and i have added a few
new things
to perfect it even more i'm somebody who
enjoys the chocolate chip cookie on the
softer side so this recipe is still
chewy softer you're not gonna lose it
it's got a little bit of crunch but i
have made the cookies just a little bit
bigger
and fluffier and chunkier and i've
topped it with salt which
changes the game you guys a little salt
and sweet the palette is just exploding
with deliciousness so today i'm gonna
share the best chocolate chip cookie
recipe with you guys let's get started
the first thing that we're gonna do to
make these delicious chocolate chip
cookies is in a large bowl we're gonna
mix together some of our dry ingredients
i'll be posting all of the ingredients
and their measurements in the
description down below so if you want to
follow along at home and try this recipe
out i recommend it you can we've got our
flour in the bowl already and i'm just
going to add our baking soda a little
bit of cornstarch and
then using a whisk whisk together till
well combined and set it off to the side
next step cream together your butters
and sugars and if you'll notice it's not
just regular sugar we're going to be
using brown sugar as well this is one of
the iconic ingredients that makes
chocolate chip cookies taste so good and
something different my old chocolate
chip cookie recipe uses couple sticks of
room temperature butter and for this
recipe we're going to be using less
butter it's about a third less and it's
going to be melted this is a big
difference it interacts with the sugars
and all of the ingredients differently
and trust me still tastes delicious all
right so we're going to add all these
ingredients into a large bowl put in the
butter i'm putting mine into a stand
mixer with a paddle attachment if you
don't have one of these that's fine you
can just use an electric hand mixer to
cream together your brown sugar and if
you don't have any brown sugar around
the house you can actually make it at
home it is regular granulated sugar with
molasses and the regular granulated
sugar okay now we're gonna lock
then on a medium speed mix together and
cream your butter and sugar also don't
forget to use a spatula to scrape down
the sides while you're mixing using
melted butter helps your cookie become a
chewy cookie now we've already used
melted butter to make this cookie soft
and chewy and now i'm going to be giving
you another tip to making a delicious
chewy cookie so in front of me i've got
two eggs but we're gonna be adding one
full egg
and from this egg just the yolk this is
gonna help the cookie be richer and
chewier so next add one full egg and a
yolk i'm just using the jiggle method
which is where i crack an egg i jiggle
the yolk back and forth letting the egg
white run all the egg white is now here
and i'm just gonna put the yolk right in
the bowl also add two and a half
teaspoons of vanilla extract once again
on a medium speed you're gonna mix all
of these together until well combined
we've got our wet mixture and our dry
mixture all ready now we are going to
combine them while this is mixing on a
low speed you're going to add your dry
mixture to your wet about a third at a
time i like to add it really slowly so
that you don't get a big poof dust cloud
and then a beautiful dough is gonna
start to form now our cookie dough is
ready but it is missing the most
important ingredient
a chocolate chips i'm using 60
bittersweet chocolate chips but you can
use darker or lighter chocolate whatever
you'd prefer you can buy the garadeli
ones that i am using at your local
grocery store your deli chocolate chips
make cookies a bite better
using a measuring cup we're gonna
measure one cup of chocolate chips and
if you like chocolate as much as me
there's just a few extra
now you're gonna fold them into your
dough if you've never folded before it's
best to use a spatula or a large wooden
spoon using your spatula you're gonna go
underneath your dough and flip over the
top and turn and you're just gonna keep
doing this until all your chocolate
chips are well integrated into the dough
our cookie dough is all ready it's
looking good smelling good and
technically you could just bake the
cookies right now but what i'm gonna do
is refrigerate let the cookie dough
chill and this is gonna allow the
cookies when you're baking them to be
fluffier so i want the perfect cookie so
i'm gonna have to wait an hour this is
where patience is a virtue so you're
just gonna take your cookie dough and
you wanna squish it together with your
hands to make a cookie ball or a disc
and then you're gonna place it on some
food safe plastic wrap wrap it up tight
and then pop it in the fridge to chill
for one to two hours chili cookie dough
i just took the cookie dough out of the
refrigerator and now we're gonna scoop
it onto our baking sheet i've also lined
the baking sheet with a piece of
parchment paper so while baking your
cookies will definitely not stick i'm
gonna be using an ice cream scoop so
that all my cookies are the same size
this scoop is about three tablespoons
that's what we're shooting for we're
gonna get right into that dough all
right i'm gonna pack it in here perfect
once you've scooped that three
tablespoons here's your hands we're
gonna roll into a ball and place onto
the cookie sheet now these cookies will
spread and you don't want to flatten
them down you want them to be nice and
tall and that's how you're going to get
that fluffiness and look because they
will spread on their own give each
cookie about two inches of room because
these cookies love to spread and we
don't want them running into each other
now it depends on what size tray you
have i'm gonna be baking my cookies six
at a time now you're just gonna pop
these in the oven you wanna heat your
oven to
375 degrees and bake for about 11 to 13
minutes the cookies are hot fresh out of
the oven be careful the pan is hot and
we're gonna leave them here on the pan
because this is a chewy cookie recipe
the cookies may look a little under
baked don't worry they're not they're
gonna continue to bake on the pan and
settle so we're gonna let them settle
but while they're still warm we're gonna
be adding our final ingredient it's more
of a topping at this point but in front
of me i've got some coarse sea salt this
is something that i've fallen in love
with we're just gonna sprinkle a little
bit of coarse sea salt over the top oh
yeah a little or a lot whatever you
fancy then the best chocolate chip
cookies are all done you're gonna let
them cool and then enjoy
here is the best chocolate chip cookie
recipe ever if you like chewy fluffy
chocolate chip cookies with a little bit
of salt this recipe may be your new
